sense.name: the ability to recall things
sense.commentary: REMEMBRANCE[+quality][+faculty][+recollection] Note: refers to a general cognitive ability to recall, not a specific instance (Sense 4)
sense.examples: The remembrance of names and dates becomes more difficult with age. These tests are designed to measure patients' remembrance before and after the brain surgery.

sense.name: social commemoration of the deceased
sense.examples: Memorial Day is held in remembrance of soldiers who died serving their country. A statue was built in remembrance of the fallen firefighters. There will be a service tomorrow afternoon in remembrance of John's uncle.

sense.name: an artifact or token that serves as a reminder
sense.examples: The guests all received small silver boxes as a remembrance of the wedding. Her only remembrance of him was a lock of his hair.

sense.name: a specific act of recalling something
sense.commentary: REMEMBRANCE[+event][+mental][+recollection] Note: implies a specific instance of recalling something.
sense.examples: A flash of remembrance passed between them at the sound of the siren. We thanked Mary for her remembrance of our passports before we left for the airport.
